TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON NORP , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in the town of LOC in LOC . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , ORG at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant sued his former employer for reinstatement , wage arrears and compensation for non - pecuniary damage .
DATE and DATE the ORG fixed CARDINAL hearings of which CARDINAL were adjourned at the applicant ’s request .
On DATE ORG dismissed the action .
On DATE ORG partly upheld the judgment of DATE , quashed the remainder of the judgment and remitted the matter for a fresh examination .
On DATE ORG dismissed the claim .
On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case for a new examination .

Of CARDINAL hearings scheduled DATE and DATE , CARDINAL were adjourned because the composition of the court was changed at the applicant ’s request or because his representative did not attend . CARDINAL hearing was adjourned because the presiding judge was ill .
On DATE the applicant successfully challenged the presiding judge .

Of CARDINAL hearings fixed DATE and DATE , CARDINAL were adjourned because the applicant did not attend and CARDINAL were adjourned because he challenged the court members or asked to stay the proceedings on various grounds .
On DATE the applicant asked the town court to change the composition of the bench . The ORG granted his request and transferred the case to another court .
On DATE the Presidium of ORG , by way of supervisory - review proceedings , quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and transferred the case back to ORG for examination .
On DATE the hearing was adjourned because the defendant did not attend .
At the hearing of DATE the applicant asked to change the composition of the bench . The request was granted .
On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and returned the case back to ORG for examination by the same bench .

Of CARDINAL hearings DATE and DATE , CARDINAL was adjourned due to the parties’ absence , CARDINAL were adjourned because the applicant did not attend , CARDINAL were adjourned because the applicant successfully challenged the bench , and CARDINAL hearing was postponed because the applicant intended to retain a new representative .
On DATE the ORG disallowed the action because the applicant had repeatedly defaulted and had not informed the court about the reasons for his absence .
On DATE ORG , on an appeal by the applicant , quashed the decision of DATE and ordered that the case should be examined by ORG .
On DATE the applicant unsuccessfully challenged the bench and the registrar . On DATE the town court ordered the applicant ’s medical examination .
On DATE the applicant appealed against the decision of CARDINAL August CARDINAL . His appeal was dismissed on DATE by ORG .
On DATE the case - file was sent to medical experts .
On DATE the experts returned the case - file to the court because medical documents had not been enclosed .
The court fixed a hearing for DATE . This hearing was adjourned because the applicant wished to retain a lawyer .
The hearing of DATE was postponed at the applicant ’s request based on unclear reasons .
On DATE ORG dismissed the claim .

On DATE the ORG quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE in the part concerning the applicant ’s reinstatement , payment of outstanding salary and compensation for non - pecuniary damage , and remitted these claims for a new examination by a different bench .
Of CARDINAL hearings DATE and DATE , CARDINAL were postponed because the applicant did not attend , CARDINAL were adjourned at the defendant ’s request and CARDINAL at the applicant ’s request .
On DATE ORG disallowed the applicant ’s action because he had persistently defaulted and appeared to have lost interest in the proceedings .
On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of DATE because the applicant had informed the court about the reasons for his absence and remitted the case for a fresh examination .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s action .
On DATE ORG upheld the judgment on appeal .
